course_title: Beginning Classical and Quranic Arabic I

001.comments: This course presumes no prior knowledge of Arabic, however if a student knows the alphabet and reads phonetically, but has no Arabic grammar they still belong in ARBC 101.Students who have received credit for ARBC 300 can not also receive credit for ARBC 101 or 102.If the course is full or blocked please register in the wait list. Please note the Department cannot provide information on your position on the waitlist.

002.comments: This course presumes no prior knowledge of Arabic, however if a student knows the alphabet and reads phonetically, but has no Arabic grammar they still belong in ARBC 101.Students who have received credit for ARBC 300 can not also receive credit for ARBC 101 or 102.If the course is full or blocked please register in the wait list. Please note the Department cannot provide information on your position on the waitlist.

WL1.comments: Wait List for ARBC 101-001. Students will be manually moved in order of registration from the waitlist to the course section as seats become available. If the course is blocked but showing available seats, waitlist transfers have not yet taken place.

description: Classical Arabic, with an introduction to vocabulary and grammar and the reading of simple Qur'anic texts and wisdom sayings in the original.
